alert.note: Alert for Dewey (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Dewey County through 245 PM CDT... At 211 PM CDT, doppler radar was tracking two strong thunderstorms 2 miles north and 10 miles west of Putnam. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Putnam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
